sentence.Network_en: Her life was her personality writ large.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的生活是她性格放大了的写照。

sentence.Network_en: The company has been served with a writ for breach of contract.
sentence.Network_cn: 这家公司因违约已接到法院令状。

sentence.Network_en: Creditors could obtain a writ for the arrest of their debtors.
sentence.Network_cn: 债权人可以获得逮捕债务人的令状.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 古老的令状（writ）制度并没有给“过失”以生存空间。这使得英国对过失所致纯粹经济损失秉持着“排除性规则（ exclusionary rule） ”。

jx.jx_en_mean: one has authority of a specified extent or kind

lj.lj_ly: Whitewall is the one area where his writ runs.
lj.lj_ls: 怀特渥尔属于他管辖范围之一。

lj.lj_ly: the unspoken question writ large upon Rose's face.
lj.lj_ls: 显而易见，露茜的脸上流露出她有一个未说出口的疑问。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English, as a general term denoting written matter, from the Germanic base of write

entry.def: A writ is a legal document that orders a person to do a particular thing.

example.ex: He issued a writ against one of his accusers.
example.tran: 他向其中一个指控他的人发了传票。

entry.def: If you say that something is writ large, you mean that it is very obvious.

example.ex: They now have to cope with the legacy of their past incompetence writ large on their balance sheets.
example.tran: 他们现在不得不处理由于过去工作不力所遗留下的问题,这在资产负债表上一看便知。

entry.def: If you say that one thing is another thing writ large, you mean that the first thing is a larger or more exaggerated version of the second thing.

example.ex: Her life was her personality writ large.
example.tran: 她的生活是她性格放大了的写照。

means.word_mean: 1. (law) a legal document issued by a court or judicial officer

auth_sentence.content: Juries are little more than electorates writ small.
auth_sentence.res_content: Juries are little more than electorates writ small.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Juries are little more than electorates writ small.

auth_sentence.content: That quality is writ large on this impressive debut album.
auth_sentence.res_content: That quality is writ large on this impressive debut album.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That quality is writ large on this impressive debut album.

auth_sentence.content: Cowbell, thankfully, is not writ large on this record.
auth_sentence.res_content: Cowbell, thankfully, is not writ large on this record.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Cowbell, thankfully, is not writ large on this record.

sentences.cn: 要求赔偿损失的文书；诽谤令状

sentences.en: A writ was filed in the High Court.
Creditors could obtain a writ for the arrest of their debtors.
sentences.cn: 债权人可以获得逮捕债务人的令状。

means.word_mean: 显而易见的；浅显易懂的

sentences.en: Mistrust was writ large on her face.
sentences.cn: 她脸上明显流露出不信任的表情。

means.word_mean: (用于名词后)扩大了的；更明显的

sentences.en: The party’s new philosophies are little more than their old beliefs writ large.
sentences.cn: 这个政党的新指道原则无非是其老信条的阐发。
